Content: More than 600,000 people have been affected by the dry weather condition. Deputy Director of the National Disaster Management Center Pradeep Kodippili says all arrangements have been made to provide reliefs to the affected people. The officers attached to the disaster management arms are functioning to support the victims of the drought around the clock. The Deputy Director said that 600 water bowsers have been deployed to provide drinking water to the affected. More than 15,000 water tanks have been positioned in the affected areas. Provisions are being made to the District Secretaries to provide relief to the affected, expeditiously. The hotline 117 has been opened to receive grievances of the victims of the drought. Deputy Director Pradeep Kodippili urged the people to use drinking water sparingly.
